alert.note: Alert for Eastern Hanover; Eastern King William; Western King William (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 11:59AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Hanover and northwestern King William Counties through 1245 PM EDT... At 1158 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Studley, or 8 miles northeast of Mechanicsville, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Manquin around 1240 PM EDT. Aylett around 1245 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Enfield, Central Garage, Rumford, Globe, Pollards Corner, Palls, Turpin, Upshaw, Etna Mills and Epworth. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Hanover; Eastern King William; Western King William
